children.text: We are going to combine two Java programs into one Fortran program.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
The first Java program (codeforces_67_B) does:
   Reads n, k, and an array bb of n integers. Then it constructs an array aa of n integers by processing from the end of bb. Finally, it prints the array aa (each element incremented by 1) as space separated.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: However, note that the output of the first program is used as input to the second. But note: the first program outputs a string of space separated integers (each is aa[i]+1) and then a newline.
children.label: mental_execution

children.text:
The second program expects a line of space separated strings and then it breaks at the first "0". So the chain is:
   Input to the entire sequence: the input of the first program (n, k, and the array bb). Then the first program produces a string of numbers (each aa[i]+1) separated by spaces and a newline. This string is the input to the second program.
children.label: mental_execution

children.text: The second program then reads that string and splits by space. Then it counts the position (starting at 1) until it finds the string "0", and outputs that position. However, note: the first program does not output the number 0 necessarily.
children.label: mental_execution

But the second program breaks when it finds the string "0". So if the first program's output does not contain "0", then the second program would output the total count of numbers?
